bibl.seg: SHAW Brent D., Explaining Incest: Brother-Sister Marriage in Graeco-Roman Egypt. Avec résumés en anglais et en français.
Man. Journal of the Royal Anthropological Institute 27 (1992) pp. 267-299, 3 tabl., 1 fig.

A significant proportion of all marriages noted in official Roman census declarations were between full brothers and sisters. The intense pressures of an economic nature and a colonial situation of a distinct ethnic ruling élite which continually defined itself in a very racist manner were the main impelling forces.
